alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 11 at 2:28PM EST until November 11 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST FOR CENTRAL HENRICO COUNTY AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 228 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Richmond, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Highland Springs and Lakeside around 240 PM EST. East Highland Park around 245 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Montrose, Richmond Heights and Dumbarton. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
